item.title: 监管机构公布隐藏数据，孟加拉国不良贷款创纪录
item.description: 孟加拉国的银行业陷入困境，因为中央银行发现了前政府以前未披露的数据，现在近四分之一的贷款已经出现问题。【原文：Bangladesh’s banking sector is in distress, as nearly a quarter of all loans have now soured after the central bank unearthed previously undisclosed data from the former government.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称通胀超调风险非常有限
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）告诉路透社，通胀率低于欧洲央行 2% 目标的威胁已经得到控制。【原文：The threat of inflation falling short of the European Central Bank’s 2% target is contained, Vice President Luis de Guindos told Reuters.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行警告：中东危机升级，石油 "在劫难逃
item.description: 据加拿大皇家银行资本市场有限责任公司（RBC Capital Markets LLC）称，随着以色列与伊朗之间的冲突持续发酵，中东地区的石油供应面临着越来越大的风险，该公司警告说，能源现在 "明显处于十字准线上"。【原文：Oil supplies from the Middle East face increasing risk as the conflict between Israel and Iran drags on, according to RBC Capital Markets LLC, which warned that energy is now “clearly in the crosshairs.”】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英镑收复失地，油价延续涨势
华盛顿邮报》调查记者电子邮件账户遭黑客攻击事件
item.description: 华盛顿邮报》正在调查针对一些记者电子邮件账户的网络攻击，这促使该报加强了网络安全。【原文：The Washington Post is investigating a cyber attack on the email accounts of some journalists, prompting the newspaper to beef up its online security.】

item.title: 美国在利率方面是个例外
item.description:
由于与其他央行的差距拉大，美联储预计将维持暂停。【原文：

The Fed is expected to maintain its pause as the gap widens with other central banks.

】

item.title: 关税担忧导致新加坡房屋销售跌至五个月低点
item.description: 由于全球关税紧张局势拖累了这个依赖贸易的城市国家的需求，新加坡 5 月份的新建私人住宅销售量降至五个月来的最低点。【原文：Singapore’s new private home sales fell to a five-month low in May, as global tariff tensions weighed on demand in the trade-dependent city-state.】

item.title: 泰国航空公司经法院批准退出债务重组计划
item.description: 泰国国际航空公司（Thai Airways International Pcl）退出债务重组计划获得法院批准，为时隔四年后恢复股票交易铺平了道路。【原文：Thai Airways International Pcl won court approval to exit a debt restructuring program, paving the way for resumption of trading in its stocks after a four-year gap.】

item.title: 维多利亚的秘密受到另一家投资者的压力，敦促其做出改变
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，维多利亚的秘密公司（Victoria's Secret & Co.【原文：Victoria’s Secret & Co. is being targeted by another activist investor seeking a shake-up of the business, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 经济学家预测德国今年将恢复增长
item.description: 接受彭博社调查的分析师认为，德国经济在经历了两年的萎缩后，将于 2025 年恢复增长。【原文：Germany’s economy will return to growth in 2025 after two years of contraction, according to analysts surveyed by Bloomberg who are a little more upbeat on the country’s near-term prospects than other forecasters.】

item.title: SNB 将降息至零，但暂时不会实行负利率
item.description: 根据彭博社对经济学家的调查，瑞士国家银行本周可能会将利率降至零，并在一段时间内保持不变。【原文：The Swiss National Bank will probably lower its interest rate to zero this week and stay there for some time, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists.】

item.title: 糟糕的英国数据加大了英国央行继续降息的压力
item.description: 一周来的糟糕数据显示，英国经济和劳动力市场在增税和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易战的重压下步履维艰，英国央行正面临着推进更多降息措施的压力。【原文：The Bank of England is facing pressure to push ahead with more interest-rate cuts after a week of woeful data showed the UK economy and labor market buckling under the weight of tax increases and US President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将再次减息，官员态度谨慎
item.description: 经济学家仍预计欧洲央行今年将再降息一次，即使在政策制定者发出他们不急于进一步放宽政策的信号之后。【原文：Economists still expect the European Central Bank to lower interest rates one more time this year, even after policymakers signaled they’re in no rush to ease further.】

item.title: Wedbush 据称将收购波兰投资银行 Trigon 的股份
item.description: 据知情人士透露，韦德布什金融服务公司（Wedbush Financial Services）正在大量收购波兰投资银行 Trigon 的少数股权。【原文：Wedbush Financial Services is taking a significant minority stake in Polish investment bank Trigon, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 棕榈油跃升至 4,000 林吉特关口上方，追随豆油和原油走势
item.description: 棕榈油跳涨突破 4000 林吉特大关，追随豆油的涨势，豆油因华盛顿提议允许炼油厂明年在汽油和柴油中掺入创纪录数量的生物燃料而大涨。【原文：Palm oil jumped above the 4,000 ringgit mark to track gains in soyoil, which surged on Washington’s proposal to allow refiners to blend a record amount of biofuels into gasoline and diesel next year.】

item.title: 中国通过临床试验加入美国大脑植入竞赛
item.description: 据《环球时报》报道，中国首次对一种允许大脑信号控制外部设备的技术进行临床试验，并取得了成功，成为继美国之后第二个达到这一阶段的国家。【原文：China’s first clinical trial of a technology that allows signals from the brain to control an external device has proved successful, making it only the second country after the US to reach this stage, according to the Global Times.】

item.title: 中东风险扩大，石油期权吸引多头激烈交易
item.description: 随着以色列和伊朗之间对抗的升级，新一波看涨情绪正在席卷石油期权市场，本周开盘时看涨期权交易异常活跃。【原文：A fresh wave of bullishness is washing through the oil-options market as the confrontation between Israel and Iran escalates, with activity led by unusually heavy trading of call options at the week’s open.】

item.title: 中国火力发电今年首次实现增长
item.description: 高温炙烤着中国部分地区，中国庞大的煤炭和天然气发电厂的发电量在 2025 年首次实现同比增长。【原文：China’s massive fleet of coal and gas power plants logged the first year-on-year gain in electricity generation for 2025 following blistering heat that baked parts of the country.】

item.title: 中国政府限制措施开始生效，中国削减钢铁产量
item.description: 由于钢厂响应政府的减产承诺，中国 5 月份的钢产量与上年同期相比大幅下降。【原文：China churned out a lot less steel in May compared to the previous year as mills responded to the government’s pledge to cut production.】

item.title: 低通胀率有助于印度卢比抵御中东风暴
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 中国零售销售额创 2023 年以来最大增幅，关税效应得到缓解
item.description: 5 月份，中国国内消费出人意料地大幅增长，经济在关税的过山车中平稳前行，这为正面临与美国长期贸易战威胁的中国政府提振了信心。【原文：China’s domestic consumption surprisingly jumped as the economy rode out the tariff rollercoaster in May, offering a confidence boost to Beijing as it stares down the threat of a prolonged trade war with the US.】

item.title: 中国房价加速下跌，官员誓言提供支持
item.description: 5 月份，中国新房价格创下 7 个月来最大降幅，这凸显了政府高官再次承诺重振房地产市场的原因。【原文：China’s new-home prices fell the most in seven months in May, underscoring why senior government officials are renewing pledges to revive the property market.】

item.title: 印尼交易所考虑将交易窗口延长一小时
item.description: 印尼证券交易所将考虑延长交易时间，这是该交易所在今年早些时候遭遇重挫后，为吸引外国投资者进入这个东南亚最大经济体所做的最新努力。【原文：Indonesia’s stock exchange will consider extending trading hours, in its latest effort to draw foreign investors to Southeast Asia’s biggest economy after heavy selloffs earlier this year.】

item.title: 民调显示石破支持率在大选前回升
item.description: 最新民意调查显示，在日本政府着手解决大米价格高企问题后，公众对首相的支持率有所上升，这对即将参加大选并努力与美国达成贸易协议的石破茂来说是一个积极的信号。【原文：Public support for Japan’s prime minister is holding up after the government moved to address high rice prices, according to new opinion polls, a positive sign for Shigeru Ishiba as he heads into an election and tries to reach a trade agreement with the US.】

item.title: 以色列和伊朗继续互相攻击，战事愈演愈烈
item.description: 周一，以色列和伊朗之间的公开敌对行动进入了第四天，没有丝毫缓和的迹象，这加剧了人们对这一石油资源丰富地区爆发更大规模战争的担忧。【原文：Open hostilities between Israel and Iran entered a fourth day on Monday with no sign of easing, stoking fears of a wider war in the oil-rich region.】

item.title: 日本债券混乱预示全球市场波动加剧
item.description: 日本一度沉睡的债券市场重新焕发生机，其波动性在全球范围内引起反响。【原文：Japan’s once-slumbering bond market has roared back to life with a burst of volatility that is echoing around the world.】

item.title: 波动性上升后，日本央行将考虑放缓削减债券购买计划
item.description: 日本央行将考虑是否以更慢的速度缩减债券购买规模，同时维持基准利率不变，债券市场将密切关注这一决定。【原文：The Bank of Japan is set to consider whether to taper its bond purchases at a slower pace while also leaving its benchmark interest rate unchanged, in a decision that will be closely scrutinized by the bond market.】

item.title: 英国立法者抨击不负责任的水务公司领导人
item.description: 英国立法者呼吁对该国的水务部门实行更负责任的所有权，在此之前的几十年里，该国的关键基础设施一直是为了私募股权投资者的利益而运营。【原文：UK lawmakers called for more responsible ownership of the country’s water sector, after decades during which critical infrastructure was run for the benefit of private equity investors.】

item.title: Rightmove 称伦敦房价下调是为了吸引受税收影响的买家
item.description: 据房地产中介称，伦敦的房屋卖家在6月份将要价降低了近7000英镑（约合9481.5美元），以吸引面临更高税收和更多选择的买家。【原文：London home sellers slashed almost £7,000 ($9,481.5) off their asking prices in June to attract buyers facing higher taxes and greater choice, according to real estate agents.】

item.title: 马来西亚石油巨头马来西亚国家石油公司（Petronas）向海外寻求帮助，以降低生产成本
item.description: 马来西亚国有石油天然气公司（Petroliam Nasional Bhd.）正在寻求扩大海外更廉价资产的产量，以努力降低生产成本，控制利润下滑。【原文：Petroliam Nasional Bhd., Malaysia’s state-owned oil and gas company, is looking to expand output from more affordable assets abroad in an effort to cut production costs and rein in declining profits.】
